content.text: The Disciplinary Commission is appointed by the Minister for Health to oversee the appointment of Disciplinary Tribunals (DTs) and their processes and procedures.

cards.title: Prof Lee Eng Hin (President)
cards.imageAlt: An image of Prof Lee Eng Hin
cards.text: Emeritus Consultant in Orthopaedic Surgery, National University Hospital

cards.title: Prof Walter Tan Tiang Lee
cards.imageAlt: An image of Prof Walter Tan Tiang Lee
cards.text: Medical Director and Consultant Plastic Surgeon, Raffles Hospital

cards.title: Prof Sonny Wang Yee Tang
cards.imageAlt: An image of Prof Sonny Wang Yee Tang
cards.text: Emeritus Consultant in Respiratory Medicine, Tan Tock Seng Hospital

cards.title: Mr Thio Shen Yi, SC
cards.imageAlt: An image of Mr Thio Shen Yi, SC
cards.text: Joint Managing Partner, TSMP Law Corporation

cards.title: Mr Toh Han Li
cards.imageAlt: An image of Mr Toh Han Li

content.text: Some of the functions of the Disciplinary Commission include appointing DTs, overseeing the procedures and processes of DTs, and overseeing the training of members of the Complaints Panel and Health Committees.

content.title: Our Logo
content.description: Our logo depicts letters D and C for the Disciplinary Commission. The abstract lighthouse beacon symbolises guidance from the DC for the Disciplinary Tribunals and Complaints Panels.

contentPageHeader.summary: Learn more about what the Disciplinary Commission (DC) does here.
